result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadiki F Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sadiki F Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Sadiki F Johnson.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel advises that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea Hearing to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from defendant.  (Sadiki F. Johnson - #2022007564, House of Correction - #2022007564, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Sadiki F Johnson not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Case adjourned to Branch 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in Room 503 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 6-28-22

Defendant Sadiki F Johnson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense has received discovery and an offer and is requesting additonal time. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Sadiki F Johnson in court with attorney Robet Hampton .  Gregg Herman appeared in person and Julie Knyszek appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case # 16CF5186 that are attached to the complaint. Sworn for the State: MPD officer A. Dey. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.2.22

Remaining cash bail posted can be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Sadiki F Johnson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriff's Department:
04/15/22.    22RM021234
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
